title: Does putting my name on the deed would affect my credit score based on debt of other person on the deed?
question: Hello, My mother passed away. My sister was co-signer on the mortgage and now she asked me to be added on the deed. I know she has a lien on the house for unpaid credit card. If I put myself on the deed will I be responsible for repaying her debts and will that affect my credit score?
question_tags: Business contracts,Bankruptcy,Credit score,Credit,Debt,Lien,Bankruptcy and debt,Property deed,Property title,Foreclosure,Real estate and bankruptcy,Real estate
answers:
Adding your name to title will not impact your credit at all. Only the mortgage company reports the mortgage to the credit agencies. You are not listed as a debtor to them. Your only potential credit downside is if there is a judicial foreclosure of the property your name will be shown as part of the judgment.
